pEpUzlTTItV0oZLXs0wdjA.text: I've always passed Murray Avenue Grill, but never decided here for dinner for some reason. So, when it was my decision to pick a nice restaurant for Valentine's Day, I decided on MAG since none of us have tried it. They did not take reservations but the girl on the phone informed me that the wait wasn't too bad, but I could also call when on my way (i forgot! lol)   We walked in and were told that it'd be a half hour wait for our party of 4. It actually only took 2 minutes because someone left right afterwards. The host was super friendly! Wow, that guy needs to take his friendliness to the next level (serving!)   MAG offered the regular menu as well as a Valentine's Day menu (score!) The V-day menu consisted of entrees of steak w. crabmeat & asparagus, lobster, steak & lobster, ribs or burger & fries. Bobby and I each decided on the steak & lobster.   I know many have already explained, but MAG has GREAT steak! I almost asked the server for steak sauce until I tasted how juicy & flavorful the steak was! The lobster was even better. We've had lobster at another restaurant, but MAG's was flawless (in fact, a man at the table across from us stopped over to ask how good the lobster was) I ordered the steamed veggies as a side &  Bobby had the asparagus- which by the way he said was the 2nd best asparagus he's had. (Don't worry, I informed him it's a little weird to have a top 5 asparagus list) Our friends ordered the rib entree & another ordered the burger & fries. All looked delish and everyone said it was a good decision to come here! For dessert, my friend & I split the chocolate cake. Do yourself a favor and choose that as your dessert. It literally knocked our socks off!   So our v-day dinner was great. The only awkward part was the server. She seemed on the debbie-downer side, which flipping lasted our entire meal. When we asked what was wrong, she said that it was a slow night, partly because no regulars we there. Server Etiquette 101: dont inform new patrons at your restaurant that you miss your regulars.. especially on Valentine's Day when we're about to have a $150 table bill. Part of me wished the happy-go-lucky host could've been promoted at that moment to our server. The food made up for it though!   I'm excited to head back here in the Spring to enjoy the outdoor seating.

NhQBGDc0v7s4_ueEbLC6sA.text: Good food at good prices, the Murray Avenue Grill is a great traditional Squirrel Hill restaurant.  Pretty run of the mill American food... burgers, crab cakes, different salads, and traditional specials.  I've never had a meal that I didn't like.    The location is great - right across from the Manor Theater.  A perfect spot for date night after the movie.  One thing they do exceptionally well is their desserts!    They aren't made in house but, if they don't have a pastry chef, that's probably a smart move.  Plus, they buy local.  Try Prantl's famous almond torte!  It's the perfect end to a delicious meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Caesar Salad

l1G-wInhr5J5pYQXTpzJOA.text: Great little find. Had the best Pittsburgh salad here a few weeks ago.

UA4IP5fLeuDy89N0vXmaXw.text: The food is excellent and good helping sizes. My sandwich was excellent and definitely enough for left overs. It was cooked to perfection and the meat was delectable.   They need to change their root beer company. It was weak in comparison to most I've had. Hank's is kinda meh, IBC is definitely the bottle I would go with.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket literally tastes good in every form.

HUYdrnD8Y2IXUZ42B0fM2Q.text: I am sad to report that we will not eat at Murray Ave Grill any longer. It's sad because it is a great location and can serve good food and we like the atmosphere. However the last two times we went there it was awful.   Two times ago my cheeseburger, ordered Medium done, was completely bloody RARE with no cheese. I sent it back and it came out with cheese melted in top and still completely RARE inside! What?? The waitress and the manager apologized and gave us a free dessert so we decided to try again.   Last week, on my bday, I went to a movie at The Manor then met my hubby for dinner at the Grill to eat dinner and watch the Penguins. I ordered the beef brisket sandwich, which is advertised as the Best Brisket. It tasted pretty good but not The Best. I got the most awful food poisoning later that night. Vomiting, chills, sweats and all of the other grossness you can think of. I missed work the next day and couldn't get out of bed until about 4pm. Happy bday to me?  So no more Murray Ave Grill for us. It's too unpredictable and I don't want to end up in the hospital.

NLvxJv9PERBM7Mbc5BrjdA.text: Absolutely a let down from start to finish. I do not recommend this at all. When you walk in you will notice that the place has an odd shape and setup with the bar on the left and the dining tables in old fashioned booths cramped in a very dimly lit back area with a view of the kitchen that has no door. The official photos seem to purposefully obscure this setup.   Secondly, our particular male waiter was inattentive and noticeably unfriendly. I saw another table with a nice waitress who had much better service. So perhaps the guy we had just needs fired. I mean, even the busboy, who noticed our drinks and water were empty, was much more cordial.  Now on to the food, but first, if you want to know how NOT to design a menu, then come to this place. It's absolutely all over the place and strangely difficult to read. More importantly the food was poor, and the main dishes were overpriced. I've never been to a restaurant where the "House Favorites" were the worst dishes. Despite taking almost 30 minutes to come out, The New York Strip Steak was extremely bland and undercooked. It tasted like they threw a frozen steak in the oven. My 2 sides were equally as bad. The grilled asparagus was soggy and probably the worst I've ever had a restaurant. The pasta and sauce was even worse. There was barely any sauce, and I've tasted better from Ragu and Prego.  I wanted to like this place, but I can't at all. Perhaps it is suitable for drinks by the window on a nice day. Otherwise, avoid it.

54DQvmL5u7LXcArCIEIjig.text: Murray Avenue Grill is OK. I've only had the vegetarian food, so that may be biasing my opinion. I had the black-bean burger, and it was passable, but you can get a better tasting veggie burger elsewhere(current favorite in Pittsburgh is at Stack'd).  The brunch item I had was much better. The Nutella + bananas Challah french toast was quite good, big, and filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Challah french toast with whipped cream, Nutella, and bananas.

CunnEcpPBrY7lVXTbHQwUg.text: Stopped by this locale for soup and sandwiches 'to go' today and was appalled by the conversation between 3 employees standing around the bar.  One asked the other two if they had ever 'child molested a cat' and then went on to ask why child molesters are so vilified!  First and foremost - abhorrent ignorance is alive and well.  Secondly, awareness of your surroundings while conversing at work is obviously not a requirement to work at the Murray Avenue Grill.  As I left I told the bartender I had hoped I misunderstood their conversation and was told 'that's why we call him a freak'.  NEVER going back and recommend the same for all.  Management must hold employees accountable for their actions AND words in front of customers.

dgtv6c0p-vpjJq1y1Yjl4w.text: We were in the area and decided to eat at t the closest place to where we parked. Crazy but interesting. This is where we dined. My husband had a Buffalo Chicken wrap. It was chicken with buffalo sauce, lettuce, and cheese in a wrap. Basic but tasty. I had a salad that had grilled chicken, black beans, corn, roasted red peppers and tortilla strips. Again, basic but tasty. The best part of the meal was dessert. We had the apple dumpling with cinnamon ice cream. Yum!  We were sharing it and we devoured it quickly!

pxawrkN-BXsVnIXK6nxCCw.text: The food here is pretty good. I got a side salad and the saxonburger (turkey instead of beef) with sweet potato fries. The turkey burger wasn't made from ground meat, which I didn't appreciate. It was more like the patties you buy frozen and throw on the grill. But it still tasted good along with the fried pickles, cheddar, and chipotle mayo that made up the sandwich.    Ultimately, it's a comfortable environment with two or three TVs. So you can watch the game or just have a nice meal with friends. The menu is interesting. I wouldn't mind going back to try a few others options.

edzy2zDoyKPAd5HWV6y_fQ.text: We had great service and our food came out promptly. The lamb burger was great tasting and the portion size of the French fries bordered on absurd.   I would suggest steering clear of the smoked brisket. The meat lack any smoke flavoring and was tough and chewy. Not what you want in a sandwich.   From my seat I had a clear view of a prep area of the kitchen. I do not like to see non-restaurant personnel entering and exiting the kitchen as if a party is happening back there while my food is being prepped. Also, I know we all have to eat to survive, but I don't want to see people eating in the kitchen when I can't also see them washing their hands afterward.   Over all this is a good place to stop for a bite to eat, however, just keep in mind every menu item isn't a hit. Murray Ave Grill clearly aspires to be a good restaurant, but they're just not there and can work to improve.   Despite my criticisms I would still give it another try.

_PiIo3FipBzCsTlIUs-osw.text: I've lived in Squirrel Hill for almost 26 years and this place has been here as long as I can remember. I keep hoping I'll get the quality of food as described on its menu, but am often disappointed. Take last Sunday night during NBA game  7. I placed an order by phone to take out, which was ready for pick up on time.I don't think that had anything to do with what I got unless whoever was in the kitchen was glued to the TV screen. Cheeseburger sliders: way over done. Salmon burger: all bread crumbs. Fries: three-inch soggy brown tasteless shapes. Lump crab cakes were shredded and lump-less (but tasty). The staff's always been pretty nice.

2R0yUj3z8DKwlW8ROLRtpA.text: So far it's horrible...their house salad taste like a salad you would get if you went to a wedding and pre ordered your food two months ahead. Everything is just very stale tasting. They give you this dry ass dinner roll that's cold and hard...no wonder why there's a lot of old people in here.

GQUktDmtSe4UH-ac9Rf14w.text: Wonderful hamburgers.  Friendly service.  You have to try the Fried Pickles. I have been here 3 times this week (Including Fathers Day).  Fathers day I treated myself to a dark on tap beer.     When I asked if I could avoid the Carb side with the hamburger - they offered grilled asparagus  - class act.  Sodas are refilled, a bunch.   Beer was good.   Only problem - is even if people are waiting - they don't push you out (I mean you have your check, its just they don't aggressively clear you away to make you unwelcome) so you might end up feeling guilty.  All in all - a great find.

PNEf7I9HvI8UCOdx1clEIQ.text: This place is good! Gf got the zucchini which was great and I had a burger that was great. Seems like more of a nicer sit down place but we were just getting something quick.

r0YMYdBbsLXN3o9U-oPicQ.text: In Squirrel Hill, there are many restaurants  yet only a few good ones and Murray Avenue Grill remains one of the best!   The food is always good and consistent, the staff becomes like family and the overall vibe is that of a intimate neighborhood restaurant.  My family has eaten in many good restaurants yet Murray Ave. Grill remains our " go to"place and my children think that it is an extension of home.  By the way, there's been much talk as to who makes the best hamburger in Pittsburgh and our vote goes here and, yes, as reviews state, the Cobb Salad is delicious!

bD4A4NMzY8Kar82mj3-EwA.text: Me and my wife eat there a lot and it is never not been perfect the food there is always very hot and very delicious the manager and the wait staff are also very good 5 stars all around I recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a great dinner

IU1ouxnQPcZC5EiP93gZDA.text: We love this small restaurant/bar in Squirrel Hill. Amazing salmon burgers and sweet potato fries, huge salads, grilled cheese sandwiches, among many other dishes. We've not tried the Sunday brunch but have heard this is good as well. Prantl's almond torte is on the dessert menu. Come before or after a movie across the street at the Manor Theater.

fYI02-vvLx41bY-4tKweZQ.text: I have not been here in a decade and the place was dramatically different then last I went. I was very impressed with the food and the service.  We had a capresse flat bread for an appetizer which is very good and enough for two.  We also each had a burger.  Mine was  a perfect medium rare.   The server was very good and the decor is nice and comfortable.   I can't recommend this place highly enough

fMbBJTDBVHvvB4UTN84x2w.text: Squirrel Hill is one of the best areas in Pittsburgh for diverse dining options, but it is still nice seeing a place serving up good ol' fashioned American amidst all the other cultures.   The space is long and narrow with a bar to the left right when you walk in. Murray Avenue Grill is not what I would call fancy; it's more so a traditional bar and grill, but the booths also reminded me of a family restaurant. They serve traditional American items like burgers, wraps, salads, etc. In terms of taste, flavors were okay. Our party of three ordered fish tacos, a hamburger and a veggie burger. I can only speak on the fish tacos which were rather bland and ordinary.   Although the food was ok, the service was on point. The gentleman taking care of us was very attentive and friendly when we had questions. Food also came out very quickly and we were in and out.  Overall, dinner wasn't all that special and I may or may not come back. With all the other options in this area, it's hard to choose this spot over the others.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burger with Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish Tacos

enRP-BbcyUfQUcZQmhAlug.text: Poor.  They would hold a table for 6 and then gave it away as another group walked in before us!  We sat at the bar.  Our food still didn't come and we asked to be moved to a large table as the restaurant literally cleared out.  Their response was we can't have you move to a table once you have placed your order.  Really?  The place was empty...  what's the worry, your bartender wouldn't get a tip?  Don't worry, we won't be coming back or recommending this place to anyone. Poor customer experience provided by the manager and the hostess.

PHuPGyjO0ZdnsMrXK5XjHw.text: I visited Murray Ave. Grill with three friends for brunch last Sun.  Given that I'm always a fan of a good brunch and that I'd heard favorable reviews of theirs, I suggested that we try it out, and my friends humored me, given that it was my last outing in PGH with some of them.  For my entree, I ordered the goat cheese scramble ($9.95), which contained asparagus and sun dried tomato in addition to goat cheese and eggs.  While the portion was a bit on the small side, I found it filling as well as very flavorful, and they certainly didn't skimp on my favorite ingredient--goat cheese!  It also came with a latke and an English muffin on the side, so altogether, the portion size actually wasn't bad.  I requested sour cream for the latke, which was brought at no extra cost, and the latke itself was crispy and fluffy.  Two of my friends ordered the hobo hash ($9.95), which consists of Yukon gold potatoes, scrambled eggs, bacon, cheddar cheese, and diced potatoes.  Although they agreed with me that the portion was on the smaller size, they also found it filling and enjoyed it very much.  My other friend ordered the lamb burger with sweet potato fries ($10.95).  She said the lamb was very well-cooked, and she thought the fries complemented it well.  Given that this was my last brunch in PGH and that I'd never had a full Bloody Mary before, I decided to splurge and get one ($5).  While I don't have a standard of taste to go by, I can say that it wasn't nearly as large or elaborate as some of the other Bloodies offered at various other brunch places around town.  Trying this drink confirmed my suspicion that Bloodies aren't my preferred brunch drink of choice (I'm more into mimosas and bellinis), but at least I can say I've actually had one now!  The restaurant's interior isn't very distinctive--it's basically a bar with some dining tables.  However, service was very friendly and accommodating, which we appreciated.  The clientele is a bit on the geriatric side--at the time of our visit, almost all of the other customers had gray hair and/or facial wrinkles.  Nevertheless, if you enjoy savory brunch items, Murray Ave. Grill offers a nice alternative to Pamela's, similar to Nu Jewish Bistro in many respects. If you're in Squirrel Hill and are looking for brunch options, it's certainly worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Goat cheese scramble
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lamb burger
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hobo hash

NE5mVUIqiZacyqFMsx9U3g.text: Just had our first meal ever in Pittsburgh.  Went to Murray Avenue Grill for some burgers.   Unfortunately they had an issue with their equipment.   They were nice but here was lunch:  some dinner rolls and fries/ onion rings.  Disappointment.  Only a couple of meals left in this city.   Hope they are better.  Pittsburgh needs to represent.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YgNCJsIKGNnFfLR63jhNLA.text: Another local place that's just ok. Not bad but ok. I've had burgers, salads and chicken sandwiches here. They were tasty but not anything to write home about.

GsMcwAVkt7B8F91H95DJdA.text: I have to say that the specials menu is worth checking out!!  I ordered the Veggie burger and coleslaw off the specials lunch menu and it did not disappoint. I ended up taking the coleslaw and my table's unwanted red onion to make my burger and thought it was great and very filling. I would recommend it !!

iI45D4zrZ5sLC9LJg8v9Yw.text: This place seems like a local fixture, and we have been here once before and had a perfectly fine experience. This time, we left feeling very dissatisfied at both the food and the service.    The menu is standard bar/grille fare, at a reasonable price, so we thought it would be a reliable place to take an out of town visitor.  I had a salad, which was solidly fine.  But two of three in our party had burgers, which was where the problem occurred.  While we were waiting, the table next to us complained that their burgers had been undercooked.  Maybe this led the kitchen staff to crank up the grill, but both of my companions' burgers arrived completely over-done.  The medium burger arrived well-done but with a crispy exterior, and the medium-well burger arrived completely black.    After trying to suck it up and eat them, we asked for the medium-well burger to be redone.  Almost immediately, our companion reconsidered since too much time had elapsed, and she had eaten too much of a gross burnt burger.  It took a while to flag down someone from the wait staff, and when we did, our waitress, Joy, seemed actively irritated.  And being polite, our companion agreed to wait for a burger she didn't want, and didn't end up eating.    We never received an apology from any waitstaff or our waitress, and we were charged full price for the burger.   I don't think we'll be coming back, as there are so many good food options in Squirrel Hill.

B-oC0JoMkdKiLLj2DFE5rw.text: We went in thinking this is going to be a good place to dine with a baby; however we found the staff esp the bartender quite condescending. The waiter was very nice to us. The bathroom also doesn't have a diaper changing seat for those who care. I am not going to give them a one star because their food may be good.

5h-dOlG9IezZb2mdjg6auA.text: Nice food although it could be better. But, definitely one of the nicest places on Murray ave that you can go for a late night dinner.  I've been there a couple of times and I very much loved the beef brisket sandwich

2EyHtTnojCI6Go9jAnnmLw.text: The Murray Avenue Grill is pretty close to being a staple in my food diet.  Empty fridge?  Choosy tastebud?  Want your dollar to go far?  Those seem to be all the questions I ask myself before I head out.  For a really reasonable price, you can get enough food to leave you stuffed one day and the next.  My boyfriend usually always goes for the full rack of ribs (includes two sides) for about $20.  I usually go for the specials because I like the idea of the menu changing daily.  The cooks there always seem to be combining new flavors to common dishes.  If you're looking for that diner feel, with a personal touch, look no further than the Murray Avenue Grill.

Knj3AJ6o1QQBjFUorOr4lQ.text: It's pretty basic. I had the chicken Panini which was very much just okay, as were the sweet potato fries. They do get kudos on the portion sizes though, I could not finish the fries and the sandwich comes with a HUGE piece of chicken. The wait staff was friendly and attentive and the food came out quickly. I requested an Arnold Palmer and was quickly obliged though the preparation wasn't perfect (this is really just for the Arnold Palmer snobs out there). I will also give a big plus for the menu having a TON of options. Better quality than a lot of diners but with the same concept. Still nothing worth writing home about, with so many other choices nearby I would suggest you keep it moving.

TxAixaXlbz-EnRguamyEvg.text: My boyfriend finished a half-marathon length training run late one weeknight and suggested we come here for food, since the kitchen is open later than most during the week. We both wanted burgers, and he assured me that theirs were really good. We arrived and were seated immediately, since only two other tables and a few seats at the bar were occupied. The table next to us was a group of obnoxious teenagers, which I suppose is to be expected given the neighborhood. Our waitress was friendly but seemed almost intimidated by the older gentleman (owner? manager?) floating around behind her, and repeatedly apologized for things like carding us saying she'd lose her job if she didn't. She took our orders, and the food and drinks arrived within fifteen minutes easily.  I had a burger with gouda cheese, and Kyle had something similar. We both went with regular fries as a side. The fries were good, but a tad stringy and greasy in a dark way for my taste...almost as if the fry oil was old. The burger was tasty, but the whole thing fell apart before I was halfway through. I think the integrity of the bun had something to do with it. The gouda cheese was also sliced very thickly and not melted. That's a personal quibble, but I like to see small details like that done right. Overall I might come back here if I was in Squirrel Hill late at night and craving something very specific, but it didn't wow me. If a place has amazing food and service it won't matter if it's my scene, but nothing was great enough to balance out the super conservative atmosphere and teenage clientele.

114myQWen9M1t1OftQ98qQ.text: Good service and good food! Burgers here are very tasty but on this night I wanted something different.  I decided on their chicken scalloppini...which was grilled chicken over penne with oven roasted tomatoes, capers and artichokes in a butter garlic sauce with some parm on top. I'm glad most of the sauce collected at the bottom so it wasn't greasy. It was seasoned well but not too salty. The capers set the dish off and it was very yummy. The entree came with a salad and a roll too. My dinner date had the spicy chicken wrap which was also very good. I had a malibu punch which took me to the tropics for a moment at least. Our waitress was very kind and attentive.  I've always liked the atmosphere here and the service. I'm looking forward to going back and trying more of their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy chicken wrap
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken scallopini

IKmSnShfDMgVGmLMIxOlQg.text: A neighborhood gem that's for sure. They have a variety of menu choices. We try to experiment and not stay with any one dish. But, I must say, I love the fried pickles! Their salads and dressing are terrific and another staple is the chicken fingers. Burgers are high on the list and they rotate a special burger each day. Worth trying all of them. We once had a hotdog/hamburger-interesting, you might say. Well, also awesome!! It was so good-like a picnic on a bun! They usually have a wait if you go at peak hours. They also have a few outdoor tables that fill up quickly. They do not take reservations and you can't call ahead. So plan accordingly. They have a bar with seating where you can get food as well. I did not like the lamb burger-it has too many spices that take away from the lamb taste. Would love it to be more plan. Also, the rolls with the salads are not very good. But, who cares! Don't eat the roll!!  The space is an odd shape that might limit table capacity, but can't really think of another floor plan. But, it all works. They stay busy and their food is fresh.  The staff is great-always happy and timely. Will be back for the 98th time very soon!!!:-)

YY5tI5H6Qci6aowNHz-tqA.text: So the two stars are for the food and not the customer service, which was great! However, when I am paying $30 dollars for a filet minion steak, I expect it to be cooked correctly and to have some flavor. Zero stars. Also the sides.... $30 dollars for a dish and you serve me four asparagus spears and five tiny potatoes!? I am not kidding - 5 very small potatoes. Wow! I was embarrassed, because I took my Mom here for a nice meal. Should've gone to Outback. Same prices, but better quality. I won't be back.

b1vHk22LYzl2M6AjhAzrqw.text: I came to Murray Avenue Grill for my birthday brunch a few months ago, and I was impressed.  My friend and I had been hoping to go to Pamela's, but when the wait was two hours, we decided to try here out.  There was no wait on a Sunday morning around 10:30.  I've yet to try Pamela's, but I don't think I'll ever make it there since this is right across the street!  How do you start brunch on your birthday?  With a birthday mimosa, of course!  The mimosa was delicious and not terribly priced.  From there I moved to a massive breakfast burrito, covered in tomatoes.  I couldn't quite finish the whole thing, but I took it to go and ate it later.  I definitely would order it again.  My friend ordered steak and eggs, and the steaks were a really nice size for the price.  The wait staff was friendly, and I cannot wait to come back here to try out the lunch and dinner menus!

dLPPmf1JX4SWEKcK3Ezfow.text: Best Burgers in Pittsburgh.....hands down! Salads are excellent! Food is always consistent and thats why I come once or twice a week for last 25 years!

iNEVj7qzE_2gGnIV8GDORw.text: This is my third visit, once for lunch and twice for dinner.  While the menu doesn't correspond to what is on their website, our waiter last night didn't really seem to care and that was our whole experience!   Food was good, I did ask for a medium well burger and got well! Minor point but the attitude of our waiter has made us cross this place off our list for awhile.  Hopefully he will find his calling outside of this place!

Ns1vDRunXVJi4O5-38Jlzg.text: Stopped in after a long road trip from California. The staff was overly friendly and helpful. We went in at 9pm on a Thursday night and the place was packed! They have a lengthy menu allowing you to get whatever you would like. They also have a great cocktail list and beer selection. I had a Moscow mule that was on the sweet side - but hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Summer cocktails

Gf-V9o6DlchzRNkpbsFrrg.text: The original plan was to go to Pizza Cono, but they were closed on Sunday at noon. Very strange!  After walking around for a bit, Bethany and I decided to try out Murray Avenue Grill. I was in the mood for breakfast; she wanted lunch. We weren't even thinking, "Hello, it's Sunday - get brunch!" Luckily, MAG was able to fulfill both of our needs. I had a simple portobello mushroom/green pepper/swiss cheese omelette. It was so very good and rich. The potato pancake side was yummy. The english muffin wasn't toasted (sad). Bethany had a burger and fries (which were very yummy). A very nice, classy place. I'm glad we went and I definitely want to go back for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Portobello mushroom, green pepper, swiss cheese omelette...with potato pancake and english muffin

bLHF6bbo7H9KlpUmc3W0EA.text: Came across this place just walking down Murray ave looking for a place to eat. Didn't check yelp beforehand but was surprised to see this place is not more highly rated. We came on a Saturday night so we expected the wait to be pretty bad but it was only ~20 minutes.   The servers and greeter were all super friendly and courteous. I got the brisket sandwich and my wife go the crab cake sandwich which were both amazingly delicious. She had also gotten a French onion soup which I'm usually not a fan of, but I tried it and just had to order another one for myself. Oh and the sweet potato fries were very crispy and fresh as well. You can get it for just an extra dollar with your entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French onion soup

mlwVZpZnTej6tYYPZ3I6LA.text: This place has a nice chill environment, but the food is horrible. I would never come hack here.  The wings were small and dried out, carrots were out of the baby carrots out of the bag, and wet too.   Burger was dry, should have went to McDonald.

Ff5J4mXkxaQod4BWLn52vQ.text: Like the food.  Like the service.  But...that bathroom.     So we live in Squirrel Hill and stop by this place fairly frequently.  They do a good burger and a good brunch.   And I appreciate that I can swap out the side for sweet potato fries or tater tots.  Wine is a buck too high for the selections, but even that is fine.   Service is always friendly and efficient enough.     So why three stars?   The ladies bathroom is just plain gross.  It really makes me not even want to eat there.   There is dark grime everywhere.  It honestly looks like it hasn't had a good deep-clean in a decade or more.    I stopped by with some family from out of town the other day and I cringed when she said she had to use the restroom.  Take a little pride in your space folks - cleanliness counts.

wflaAKOaHgTRVoJCveW0sQ.text: I have been to Murray Avenue Grill a few times now and have the same feeling each time. It is fine, but not a place I am dying to get back to anytime soon.   The food is good, but nothing really stands out about it. It is your typical America fare bar food that comes with a side of fries (maybe the best food they have). I generally just get a wrap or a burger.   They do have a full bar, but I wish they had more beers on tap. They do have a solid bottle selection, but I prefer drafts and they only have six, with only 2-3 crafts.   The service is nice and the ambiance is casual. The place is a bit cramped at times, but is good for groups of 2-4. You can find parking nearby usually without too much trouble. The price point here is about right, no qualms there. I'll be back as squirrel hill only has a few bars restaurants similar to MAG.

GryVef1r2Bgi7H15nEYXwA.text: The owner is so so sweet here and always makes sure to walk around and check on everybody. The drinks are a little pricey. We all really liked our food. We wished the tacos had a little more fish, it seemed like majority lettuce. the fries are really really good!! i really enjoyed the spicy chicken wrap, it's not too spicy where you need to chug water but spicy enough to have good flavor. this was my second time coming here and i will continue to come here with my family.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon burger
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. tacos
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. spicy chicken wrap

bkJQpFG04cOt5OE15v0Qjw.text: This was my favorite Salmon Salad to date.  The Salmon was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing with their balsamic vinaigrette dressing.  The salad consisted of romaine lettuce, corn, beans, roasted red peppers, etc.  I highly recommend trying this!

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8m-o_asWUKu-paSiJajvYA.text: I came in on a week night looking for a casual dinner out. I decided on a hamburger as that seemed to be the most ordered entree that night. Burgers are $11-$13 or so and come with fries. I ordered mine medium and actually got it that way! It was perfectly cooked; a nice grill on the outside that added a lot of flavor! The bun was nice but would be better toasted or heated in some way. The fries were plentiful and very thin, small and crisp: my favorite style. I also ordered a Yuengling  that was $4 and change; a little pricey for one in his area. Overall a little pricey than a chain or a dive but a clean, friendly, casual atmosphere full of people of all ages. Definitely a neighborhood establishment.

73m3RitTb0On4qtFjR_aFg.text: Murray Avenue Grill is a hidden, old gem of squirrel hill. They are located right by the corner of Forbes and Murray which is the center of squirrel hill. It is my understanding that they have been around for a pretty long time. I consider them a hidden gem because they have extremely good food at a completely reasonable price. My favorite dish is the caprese flat bread. They also have a to-die-for lamb burger. It is so popular, I heard that the employees aren't allowed to order them because they usually run out. Their beer selection could be better but I always seem to find something good to drink. Lastly, if I get dessert it is always the Prantl's almond torte cake.   This is my go to place to watch the Penguins. They have multiple TVs in their front section; however, their bar fills up fast because it is small. They also have a more intimate dining section in the back which is good for dates. I highly suggest stopping by here. I personally am trying to become a regular.

yHVoV5EiJfbsVSIoZGNKZg.text: I've ordered from here several times thanks to Uber Eats! My review is only for the quality of food as I have never been inside.   Both times I ordered a burger, the Saxonburg Burger and the Gourmet Burger. Also tried the mac and cheese. Even with taking 15-20 minutes for delivery the food arrived warm and in perfect condition, no mushy buns or fries.  All requests I entered in the app were honored.  I don't eat burgers too often but this place makes me want to eat them more! So flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

89BGAEZsUdhDMpEqSBahHg.text: First timer at the grill on murray ave and had an excellent meal. Started with the roasted red pepper hummus appetizer and was surprised how well it was prepared. The hummus was almost creamy not sure how they did that and the pita bread was toasted to a good black for flavor.   We got two entree's: Salmon salad and a smoke brisket sandwich with sweet potato fries. The salmon salad was right sized and included fresh avocado slices and plenty of red roasted peppers, included a roll and balsamic vinegarette. The smoke brisket sandwich was AWESOME! Great job reason for 5 stars. I was surprised how much brisket was on it. The bread was toasted and had coleslaw on it the slaw was superb. At every first time visit at a restaurant with brisket i order that, this ranks at the top! Great job! sweet potato fries were crispy and excellent  Topped off with almond torte which was real good great stuff there was nothing bad about this place staff was friendly and very attentive good atmosphere and cozy  will be back for brisket samich :) It had good smoke flavor too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon salad and smoked brisket sandwich with sweet potato fries

c2LHAfW6Sr8INotOo9Y5tw.text: Murray Avenue Grill was a very tasty tonight. I came to Pittsburgh on vacation to visit family and was very impressed with the food that I had for dinner here.   I had two of the specials for dinner including the spicy red bean chili with sirloin for my side and then had a Gourmet Burger Topped with Pepper Jack Cheese, Canadian Bacon and a Fried Egg on a Fresh Baked Brioche Bun.  The chili was outstanding. Wasn't too spicy at all and had wonderful flavors! Would easily get this in again with out question!   The burger was very tasty too. It was cooked to perfection and was seasoned properly. The burger itself bonded really well with all the condiments. Overall, it was a very tasty burger and only complaint I had on it is that the burger patty was smaller than the bun that it came on. It got annoying at the end because there were many bites with more bread in my mouth then patty.   Overall, I enjoyed my dinner at Murray Avenue Grill and for someone that is here on vacation I thoroughly enjoyed it. I would give it a 4.2/5 on the whole meal itself.

XiE_4y1nWE70JGyOGTKZUQ.text: Stopped here for lunch before going to a Purim party at the Jewish Community Center. I arrived shortly after it opened and was seated right away. My waitress was very friendly and helpful in describing the menu options.  Today they were featuring Sunday brunch and they had other items listed as specials on the menu for that reason. I was originally going to get the Reuben with potato pancakes and a side of two eggs but when she told me it was quite large I decided on something smaller. I ended up ordering a hamburger with portabello mushrooms, lettuce, and tomato. It comes with your choice of side of French fries, coleslaw, or potato salad. If you want sweet potato fries then you will pay a slight upcharge for them.  I got my food fairly quickly and was glad it wasn't too large since I was planning on getting a dessert at the Purim party. Both the burger and coleslaw were good. It was prepared to my request. Nothing outstanding about it but still made for a decent lunch. I happened to notice someone who had ordered a spicy chicken wrap with sweet potato fries and he told me it was indeed worthwhile.   I saw on the menu that they have Prantl's burnt almond torte as one of their desserts. Good to know for a future visit.   Definitely would recommend coming on a Sunday since you get free parking at those meters and would like to try their brunch on a future visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy chicken wrap with fries
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Portobello mushroom burger and coleslaw

Bfq_2OvZbO_4bE08-pTedg.text: Totally not worth it. Food is expensive for what it is and horrible quality. My salad had unripe avocado and falafel as dry as the Sahara.

--b7GfBltpBFrBb2yHDytQ.text: Came highly recommended by a yocal and we see why. Lamb burger w havarti, perfect bun. Fried pickle spears on Saxon burger, delicious. Breakfast Reuben between homemade potato pancakes, fantastic. I wonder if they corned and shaved their own beef, it tasted & felt different.  Delicious homemade ranch on perfectly-crisped fries. Spicy Sunday Bloody Mary had texture, was full-flavored. Staff had good attitudes, knowledgeable, food was quick, place is cute. If I lived here this would be on my short list of mainstays. Reeeeally good.

47yu9dgEFU0ST4xVo_pjug.text: Ate there last night before seeing movie at the Manor Theater.  Delicious food, wonderful well made drink and terrific service. All we could ask for!!  Can't believe it's been so long since we've been to the Murray Ave Grill.  Will return for sure. TICKET:  Brisket Sandwich with side of potato salad, husband had their special hamburger of the day with fries,  2 beers (don't know what he had, it was a current IPA), 2 moscow mules and a red pepper hummus appetizer.  All were delicious.  Can't say enough good things about this place.  And the service was outstanding too.

rT1tzh45Fs6RVi1DoiRrCA.text: Great food, fast service. Staff was very helpful and nice.

9q9W7LXrKKcRVZz0HknHEw.text: I used to come here at least once a month for dinner.  Never been here for lunch so i am not going to comment on that.     Foodwise, they used to have a special menu everyday and there is where I order from. It rotates every 2 weeks, so back ribs were every other thursday.  Their steaks are really good, and i want to say it is better than their fish most of the time.  "Chef's special" comes with 2 sides (grilled asparagus x2 for me).  Or you can change 1 side to soup for $2(?).  My wife loves their mushroom bisque, and I like their French onion soup.    Super busy on Friday, weekdays certainly have better food, better service.   4*, but not 5*, for two reasons.  1) one out of ten there is a slight disappointment.  Maybe food wasn't good enough, it was too busy... something like that. 2) The food on special menu is good, but you never know if they are in "today". I had a steak here once that was very good, but i never find out what it was.  I had a photo of it, and i brought it back and asked the staff, they cannot tell me what it was because it was from the special menu.  ANd because of this special daily menu, I used to go to their website twice a week just to see what's up.  by the way, they have a new website.  Much better looking, but no special menu section.  Either they are still updating the website, or they are changing something.  by the way (x2), they might be the only American food / grill in the Squirrel Hill.  Yes.... we definitely have more Chinese restaurants in Squirrel Hill than American grill.  Please message me if you can name another one.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. favor onion soup in town
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4Wv4y6sBNHR92PK7rZFrTw.text: I have been going to Murray ave grill for years.  It was a nice place to go to since there was something on the menu for everyone.  However my last visit 10 days ago was a horrible experience. While into my second bite of my side salad there was a live bug in it. We quietly told the waitress who only offered to bring me another one.  Fearing more contaminated lettuce I opted for fries.  The Manager came over & said he'd give us new salads. We asked how he can insure the lettuce is safe he just said you'll get new lettuce.  My big issue is neither waitress nor Manager ever apologized for this incident.  When the bill came i asked waitress what adjustment she made & she said i took off ur $2 side salad that u sent back.  I wasn't looking for something free I just felt manager could have handled better by at least apologizing.  Us long time customers will not be going back !

b1INhF0v0npeybEWJYKJGA.text: I love Murray Avenue Grill! Generous wine pours with decently priced and tasty wine selections. The staff are all pretty amazing and they take excellent care of you (Joey, Mark, Krissy, Mary, Emmie). The French onion soup is one of my favorite things on the menu. This is also my go-to place for an outstanding burger. If you are unhappy with your food, they are always willing to fix it quickly and without any problems. Murray Avenue Grill is the Cheers of Squirrel Hill!

qAByIpcn5lof5b0zA63Iww.text: Good location & friendly staff.  *happy hour 5pm-6pm - $1 off drinks*  We started off ordering beers and soups. I ordered the lobster bisque and my friend ordered the French onion soup. Both were decent. The lobster bisque could have used some chunks in it (though I understand that I'm not in a place near water- so overall, pretty good but nothing to go crazy about.) The French onion soup was also fine, though nothing mind blowing.  I ordered the salmon burger with a side of sweet potato fries. I did enjoy the sweet potato fries, just enough seasoning; though I feel the salmon burger needed the help of the aioli it came with to help spruce up the taste.  The steak sandwich was my friends choice. I did have a bite and it was flavorful, just nothing memorable. Their side of potato salad was bomb though! I'd definitely recommend the potato salad as a side.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster bisque
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French onion soup and a $9 Belgium beer
Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon burger with sweet potato fries

O7bo3c3jKgHpaRF0NIuTCw.text: Murray Avenue Grill has a fairly decent menu and the food is consistently "above average."  I have eaten here several times and, honestly, nothing I order is "outstanding" but is always "good."    The atmosphere is that of a local pub, with the bar in the middle of the place.  Many a local go there weekdays and weekends, and usually recognized by the staff.  Servers are extremely friendly and well-seasoned (most having been there for over a year) and will go out of their way to accommodate special requests.    The menu offers a variety of dishes, so everyone can pretty much find something they like.  As far as salads, I would recommend the West Coast Chicken, with cranberries, pistachios and gorgonzola paired with the Raspberry vinaigrette.  (UPDATE:  with the recent pistachio recall, I might avoid for the time being)  For sandwich eaters, I would suggest the bar-b-que beef or their "made to order" burgers.  I've tried a few of their entrees in the past and would suggest any daily fish special.  Don't bother ordering pasta.  They seem pretty lack-luster and can pretty much make the exact same dish at home.

IkhlMIQou_Q84rvn0NbtJQ.text: Everything we ordered was wonderful with very large portions. Wanted to try everything on the menu. When visiting CMU again, we will definitely eat here.

T8Y8TLHY2wuqjWIFh_nNEA.text: A nice cozy place with respect to the environment but other than this nothing impressive. Food selection and imagination is poor, while the ingredients seem not to be fresh at all. Service is decent.

Pm7hia9HyeOlLP48HHr_ow.text: Neighborhood staple that has continued to innovated its menu and introduce seasonal ingredients.  American food done right!  They have great food, great salads, and the smoked brisket sandwich is a must have!

mc3A0wp_L99EXcX2CNWEsw.text: Murray Avenue Grill has been a Squirrel Hill staple for many years.  They have great lunch specials, and they often have a wait for dinner, but we've never been discouraged from the dinner because they always keep everything calm.  Never felt rushed, the employees don't seem particularly overwhelmed, and despite being small and crowded, the restaurant never seems overly loud.  The good, is American with a kick.  Everything they make they do well.  They often keep things fresh with great and interesting specials.  The smoked brisket sandwich is a personal favorite, but I've never had anything bad.  They make a mean burger as well!

JtiZKSBGEh2GnFyPdsZeNg.text: Eh. Whole experience was lackluster. Server "greeted" us with "Can I get you anything to drink?" No hello or anything. Was pretty apathetic the whole time. We both ordered burgers, took over 20 minutes till they arrived. My Pittsburgh burger was dry and lacked flavor; the bun was twice as big as the burger. Bacon was hard, dry, and tasteless. Fries looked fresh cut but were soggy. Mr. said his was good though, once he added some mayo. Only plus is that the burger was clearly handmade and not some frozen patty.

cOidBl6khBMP03m_y4H_Qg.text: I have eaten here four times, mainly because its convenient location in front of the Manor Theater cinema.   But the food has been consistently mediocre: the chicken breast panini I had the last time was not seasoned at all and the vegetables were overcooked--this also happened with the chicken burger I had before.   The fish tacos I ordered once were overcooked and lacking in flavor too.   I am not too demanding since this place is a casual bar / restaurant, but the prices are too high for the quality of the food.  The cole slaw that accompanied my last dinner was comparable to KFC's.  Yet, the amenable bartenders and the overall good service make it more a 2 star than a 1 star place.   For a snack--the fries are ok--and a drink, it's not too bad.  Just remember that when you order the higher alcohol content draft beers you will not get your typical pint, they serve you in smaller glasses.  Strange and not cool.

NDjn7hRMOY87OkrnYdAjJA.text: This place is one of my regulars. they have great salads, dinner specials, and burgers and fries. Although normally a beef eater, I like their vegetarian black bean (or whatever it is) burger. I also like their hummus appetizer, which is fantastic. Their service is friendly and fantastic and quickly learn and welcome the regulars.

0r6mmARKN2_duxeGfumjUQ.text: Murray Ave Grill is essentially the only American restaurant in Sq Hill, so they've got you cornered if you just want a steak or salad.  The space isn't bad, but they play '50's music, which just doesn't go with anything in there.  The service is usually nice and attentive. They've got a decent beer selection, and the drinks flow until 2am.  When the weather's nice, there's outdoor seating; and they also have Sunday brunch.

_fNW2wi_q6cBQZGsHuSMQQ.text: I go to the Murray Avenue Grill a lot. I love the food,and the people that come in...

McC7bIcyNsvVNG90nfXHRA.text: One of my favorite restaurant places in Squirrel Hill that I like to go when I want to eat a burger and fries.   Dishes that I recommend:  Hot spinach and artichoke dip Pittsburgh Burger Our Famous Salmon Burger

zST-J4n3GQmUWrzAjfSGmw.text: The only thing I've eaten here was a burger, but it was a damn good burger.  I got this burger with smoked gouda, mushrooms, bacon, lettuce, and tomato. It was massive and juicy and cooked with a nice red center. I rarely finish a whole burger (I think I just get turned off toward those last few bites when the bun goes flat and the cheese starts to congeal and the lettuce is semi-wilted...you know what I'm saying...) but I completely cleaned it off the plate. Sweet potato fries were excellent albeit a tad salty for my taste.  Service was fast and friendly. No complaints about this place, honestly. The menu wasn't anything creative, but it's not trying to be. Simple, good food in Squirrel Hill.

hr2FhgqDfJ-K58sJ3r89Tg.text: This place is just perfect.  The menu changes frequently, I've eaten here dozens of times, and I've never had anything bad on the menu.  The burgers are solid, the salads are good (if strangely priced), the soups are tasty and the deserts are divine. The draft list is small, but I've always found a beer to my liking.  And the service is always just perfect.

ejGPYFjcZIGvMyNC3HLQyQ.text: I go here quite regularly, mainly because of the good selection of food and micro beer. The waiting staff and manager are really friendly, and I have always received top-notch service.  The wait can get pretty long during dinnertime (especially on Friday and Saturday). Overall though, an excellent restaurant in the Squirrel Hill area.

5lXZFMmKUV08uToZYM6XMg.text: Great burgers, however this place does not know how to make a cosmopolitan, I asked for one and was given a vodka cranberry, I was told that I could get a double. And that it would cost me 10 bucks, it was no Cosmo. The owners want to get rich off the booze and that's ok but if you can't get a decent drink, then who cares, I would spend plenty of good money in this place, but I'm not spending 18 dollars to get a real drink, c'mon guys are you telling me you would drink here or entertain a friend here. for a great Cosmo go to Tessaros or Emilianos. Your money Will ne well spent

M4A5Jrt3P0fjmycNmhB8Vg.text: I love this place but my husband hates it. Each time we come here, they must make my meal with extra care and some how always mix up his order or take forever to bring it out. 4 stars for their food, two stars for their service.

B5TwQEgfmIpBknAoNJCpNA.text: If you're in Squirrel Hill, avoid the chains and head to the Murray Ave. Grill. Unassuming, affordable and very cozy. If I didn't live across the river in South Side, I could easily see this becoming my neighborhood bar. I wandered in here with a friend on a Saturday afternoon, and had the most delicious black bean burger. My friend highly recommends the Reuben as well - she took half of hers home. Next time I'm in the neighborhood, I'm heading straight here.

BFZewd0_jejNNOSKoAB57Q.text: The food here is generally fine, but I've had some startlingly bad service at times, and was once served a "medium rare" hamburger that was so raw that it literally had white flecks of unmelted fat throughout.  And there's just nothing exciting on the menu at all.  Appetizers are generally good, but expensive for what you get.  I would allow myself to be dragged here without protesting, but I wouldn't choose to go.

OD45_sigUUSBobJ_eVs01w.text: Good beers and decent grilled foods make murray avenue a great place for dinner on a friday or satuday night.  The crowd is always a funny mix of strange 'burgh natives, professors, and students which is cool with me.

GzBQe4a05OD0purti2pymA.text: This place has really great chili and their salads are good, too.  The service is always friendly and although it used to be really smokey, I have heard it is now smoke free.

vPbyAahFMS-8brdHYlmbWw.text: The burger is good, and the beer is cold. That's really all you need to know. I've ate her about five times and NEVER had a bad meal or bad service. Note that this place is small and fills up quickly. If you go around dinner time on a Friday or Saturday, you may have to wait up to thirty minutes to get a table. Tables can fit a group of four people max.

_vpKmEZrDooxyBgjAcNTUQ.text: I wanted to add how the good the ahi tuna is.  I love their ahi tuna.    --------------------------------- I had the French Onion soup and a Cheeseburger.  Sounds standard right?  Everyone has that on their menu. Difference is, MAG has the best French Onion soup and cheeseburger around.    I had been wanting to try this place out for a while and one day I finally did.  I was starving when I arrived which made looking at the menu very difficult because they have so many excellent items to choose from that I couldn't decide.  I was craving French Onion soup so I went with that and paired it with a cheeseburger, but I could have easily gotten any number of things from the menu.  Their apps are great, their flatbreads are great, their soups are great but their entrees are where its at.  Crab cakes, filet mignon, pork chops, ahi tuna - if it can be grilled, MAG knows how to do it right.  This is one of my favorites restaurants in Pittsburgh.    ps They have a bunch of salads, a veggie wrap and pastas for the non meat-eaters.

photos.caption: Photo of Murray Avenue Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Yqfow6waLpsWHExvXRNBxw.text: Burgertory, Brgr, The Harris/Shylo Grill, all of their burgers don't hold a candle to the burgers at The Grill. The meat is a better quality, the toppings are better, and you can get a legit rare burger here. Don't bother with other places, just go here.

ea2gUAwpNwPBR0HGAtQPfw.text: Great place with a nice modern atmosphere. The food was good (not great) but the service and low wait times made up for it.

DSQCglJNCEGFCpZ1OhIgSw.text: Been going there for several years.  Love the neighborhood feel and the friendliness of the proprietor, Mark.  My wife's favorite is the Salmon Burger.  I have to try to convince her to order anything else.  I love their ribs and their burgers.  Prices are reasonable.  Service is good and food is very good.

ej3Pz6u1Ss8qUMsVRLNifA.text: Murray Avenue Grill is a rare gem.  It is a local restaurant whose owner, Mark, is on site most nights.  I was impressed when Mark remembered my name the second time I visited! The clientele ranges from very young to very old.  They play 50's music, but not too loud.  The food is very good with a good range of entrees.  They have a full bar.  With your bill at the end of the meal you get two small Tootsie rolls.  How unique is that?  I love this place and will definitely visit again when visiting Pittsburgh.  I've eaten there over a dozen times and the food and service are consistently very good. They only take reservations for parties of 6 or more, but I've never had to wait for more than 20 minutes to be seated.  Also, there may be open seats at the bar while waiting, or you can eat at the bar.

Hsm8HwVHe1Wpbcrch0aTgA.text: The food is great and the waitstaff always polite and friendly. Sitting up near the window at night is perfectly cozy. Late drink specials are a nice bonus. My only tiny issue is that I wish they offered more vegetarian options...I love the pastas and toppings-loaded veggie burger, but I would love to try something new. No matter, I do enjoy going there and would recommend it to others

ec5et8bRxy9PuvTiU9BdJA.text: I love the Pittsburgh-style salads here (delicious shoestring fries on them), and the service is quite good. There's not a big wine selection by any means, but the 6 - 8 bottles they offer would accommodate a nice range of palates. I'd recommend going for lunch, or going to the late-night happy hour (10 - midnight) and grabbing some sliders on their awesome little pretzel buns.

DQvJcM-ZgM5CuuNx5XakSw.text: You can't beat the burgers here (or any of their sandwiches) and the beer/wine selection is fantastic and constantly rotating.      Also, you can't ask for faster or friendlier service.   I will definitely be frequenting the Murray Avenue Grill.

ngd0HBSfMkksdvN_EQRh_w.text: Really great experience! The restaurant is clean, cozy, and relaxed. The service was fantastic and the food was excellent for the price. I cannot speak to the quality of the bar, as we did not order any drinks, but everything we ordered exceeded our expectations. We left feeling full, happy, and like we didn't overpay. I am new to Pittsburgh, but I will certainly be returning to Murray Avenue Grill soon...highly recommended!

5rpYfPd7OXthFy3JFo4mPA.text: Okay, update #2!  With the return of some nice weather, my Cousin Cindy and I decided to do some shopping in the neighborhood.  We hit Ten Thousand Villages and a couple of other places.  We hit the Murray Avenue Grill for Sunday Brunch.  Lemme say this:  M.A.G.'s brunch goes beyond your typical eggs, pancakes, and waffles.  Now I played it a little safer, ordering the ahi tuna salad, with grilled tomatoes and mixed veggies.  I did try the pepper parmesan dressing.  Here's a hint if you want dressing on your salad and you want to save calories.  Don't put your dressing on the salad, but rather dip the prongs of your fork in it.  You'll still get the same flavor!  Cindy tried something adventurous--the breakfast rueben..  This concoction is corned beef, Swiss, kraut, & 1000 island dressing between two potato pancakes.  Oh yes, with 2 eggs on the side!

ymDoCgQjatAxyaNaJorZZA.text: I used to live in Sq. Hill and come here quite often.  Pros: - Food.  Rather good food.  A special note should be made about the daily specials which tend to be rather eclectic and worth checking out. - Atmosphere.  I always managed to feel comfortable here whether I was in a booth, at the bar, or sitting outside. - Outside seating. - Happy hour.  They used to have a late night happy hour from something like 10pm to midnight.    Cons: - I really have none.  Verdict: I recommend it.  I typically enjoy myself there regardless of the occasion.

XOABobC-2_C8nKQ5GTVnEA.text: Good food. Although we've been going there since it first opened, last night, they wouldn't seat me in a booth until my husband arrived. I was astounded that the manager enforced this rule even though the restaurant was slow, there were no lines, my husband was already working, and I was prepared to order for us both. I felt unvalued as a customer--and one who always tips generously (30%). I have friends who have complained about the host or hostess, but I never had similar experiences until last night. So we'll be dining elsewhere now, and that's sad because we like to frequent non-chain restaurants like this one.

bkabx6oZIjdEW8PjUSKBmg.text: Two stars for their overpriced, predictable food. Four stars for their awesome beer selection. The outdoor seating is nice, it's right on Murray Ave. but somehow it doesn't feel like you're just breathing in exhaust fumes all night.  I used to live around the corner from this place, and it was a really great place to go when I was feeling flush enough. And it's so much better then the Cage or Silky's!  The food is technically upscale bar fare, but half of the food tastes like they bought it from someone else that morning, then reheated it for you. Everything tastes a little dry and a little over processed.

yUcR0dbOiXP87m16h3mRhw.text: this is my favorite restaurant in Squirrel Hill. It's always easy to get a table in the food is always excellent. After trying many things on the menu Iknow stick with the fish sandwich.  The fried pickles as fried mozzerrella are my favorites appetizers.  For dessert a slice of Prantls with Dave n Andy's ice cream always hits the spot.

dFuo7QuhMVm7yvMbTT3jeA.text: As it turns out this is pretty much my favorite restaurant in Squirrel Hill (except for maybe Silk Elephant). Everything here is good. I have gone here dozens of times with many friends and we are always pleased.   Anything you order will be good. They have large and varied salads. The Buffalo Chicken Dip appetizer is one of the best foods I have ever tasted.  They have plenty of vegetarian options.   Also the waitstaff, well, I can't get into it online... (seriously)

JqxnVzz5zlM_OSE0aIbhRg.text: Murray Ave is great, the staff is always friendly and willing to help, the food is good and you can't go wrong with their beer selections.   They have a good selection of food so anyone can find something they want and enjoy it. This is a True neighborhood place, if you go a couple of times you are going to find the same people dining there again and again, always a good sign.

sBWruUKGykdzjfV7jpBofQ.text: FREAKING AWESOME!  :)  VERY friendly staff,  GREAT food,  PERFECT!  The next time I'm in Pittsburgh I'll be eating HERE!

fA86sj6r_BbL3TUclmCOgA.text: Service staff is kind and knowledgable. Good mix of food on the menu. Great beer selection, truly I am just sitting here like a kid in a candy shop ordering all my favorite beers and having my girlfriend try them (she is not a big beer drinker). Definitely recommend coming down on a lazy Sunday.

TvFWs27HOAA3T2F9mOcbdg.text: Good breakfast and brunch, mediocre dinner and apps.  Avoid the Pamela's breakfast crowd and walk across the street to Murray Ave. grill.  Their breakfast lineup is solid, and as long as you aren't looking for the famed Pamela's pancakes, your breakfast needs will be satisfied.
